### Multiple Regression in the news

Last month the New York Times ran a story about a new approach to analyzing
testing data across states. If you read into the methods it turns out that the
new approach is to use multiple regression.

* * *

<img src="../figs/nyt-upshot.png" width="700px" />

* * *

You can find the full story [here](http://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/27/upshot/surprise-florida-and-texas-excel-in-math-and-reading-scores.html?_r=0) 
and the report that the story references
[here](http://www.urban.org/research/publication/breaking-curve-promises-and-pitfalls-using-naep-data-assess-state-role-student-achievement/view/full_report).

### Bayesian Models

The [disappearance of Malaysian Airlines flight 370](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaysia_Airlines_Flight_370) last year lead to a worldwide seffort to locate the plane. The search effort lead many to considering Bayesian
approaches.

- [Fivethiryeight.com](http://fivethirtyeight.com/features/how-statisticians-could-help-find-flight-370/)
- [NPR](http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2014/03/25/294390476/can-a-250-year-old-mathematical-theorem-find-a-missing-plane)
